entry.title: This Week in Coins: Bitcoin Barely Budges, But Render and SHIB Surge
entry.summary: Bitcoin and Ethereum made moderate moves this week, but other large-cap coins posted sizable gains—including Shiba Inu.

entry.title: FTM Soars 35% on the Week as Fantom Preps Stablecoin Relaunch
entry.summary: It's been another big week for Fantom and its native FTM token after the project outlined plans to revive its native stablecoin.

entry.title: Bitcoin NFT Mints Are Rising—But So Are Transaction Fees
entry.summary: Bitcoin users are putting assets on-chain, similar to NFTs on Ethereum, but there’s a cost to the increased activity.

entry.title: Bill Murray Walks Into a Members-Only NFT Party: I Thought It Was the 'National Federation of Tennis’
entry.summary: The actor first's NFT event was "far more fun" than a family picnic, he told Decrypt—and holders appeared to agree. But can it be replicated?

entry.title: Jack Dorsey-Backed Decentralized Twitter Alternative Damus Banned in China
entry.summary: The app, which had only debuted Tuesday, is built atop Nostr, a decentralized social media protocol.

entry.title: Bill Murray Discusses NFT Project, First Members-Only Event
entry.summary: Comedic legend Bill Murray sits down with Decrypt at his first exclusive party for NFT holders in Oceanside, California. He describes the project’s origins and why it didn’t feel “mercenary” for him to create an NFT-based membership club.

entry.title: MicroStrategy Stock Doubles Since January as Michael Saylor Stays Bullish on Bitcoin
entry.summary: The software company’s co-founder is still long on Bitcoin—despite the company posting yet another quarterly loss.

entry.title: Elon Musk Says Twitter Will Share Ad Revenue With Creators
entry.summary: It’s unclear how much creators could make per post, so don’t get too excited just yet.

entry.title: Billionaire Tim Draper's Bitcoin Pitch to Sri Lanka Falls Flat: 'We Don't Accept'
entry.summary: "We don’t want to make the crisis worse by introducing Bitcoin," the Sri Lankan central bank's Governor told the billionaire VC investor.

entry.title: Nouns Comic Books Turn Ethereum NFTs Into ‘Unconstrained Anarchy’
entry.summary: Titan Comics will publish the DAO-funded series based on the open-source IP, with physically-backed NFTs tied to special editions.

entry.title: U.S. Trustee Opposes FTX Subpoenas Aimed at Sam-Bankman Fried's Inner Circle
entry.summary: The representative of the U.S. Trustee cited potential issues surrounding unnecessary expenditures and duplication of efforts.

entry.title: What Is Ethereum’s Shanghai Upgrade?
entry.summary: The Shanghai fork will implement EIP-4895, which allows validators to withdraw ETH that have been staked since as long ago as December 2020.

entry.title: Render Token's RNDR Up Over 90% on the Week as New Tokenomics Model Passes DAO
entry.summary: The price of RNDR is up over 300% on the month, amid the launch of a new tokenomics model and the establishment of the Render Foundation.

entry.title: Logan Paul Faces ‘Rug Pull’ Class-Action Lawsuit Over CryptoZoo NFTs
entry.summary: The online influencer faces accusations that he helped to raise funds for an animal-themed NFT game that “never existed.”

entry.title: Feds, Senators Scrutinize Silvergate Bank Role in FTX Collapse
entry.summary: The probe comes during a renewed push by regulators to clamp down on the crypto industry.

entry.title: Ex-App Store Director: 'Apple Had a Problem With Crypto From Day One'
entry.summary: In an interview, Phillip Shoemaker pulls back the curtain behind Apple’s App Store and argues that the guidelines are crafted to be intentionally opaque.

entry.title: Mastercard's NFT Lead Exits, Selling Resignation Letter as NFT
entry.summary: The payment giant's former product lead for NFTs said he was "a victim of harassment and emotional distress.”

entry.title: Bitcoin Is the Ultimate Insurance Policy: Cathie Wood
entry.summary: With only your seed phrase, she says “you’ll be able to cross a border and reclaim your wealth.”

entry.title: ‘Bitcoin NFTs’ Aren’t New, But Blockchain Purists Are Now on the Defensive
entry.summary: Counterparty and Stacks set the stage for NFT-like assets built around Bitcoin, but Ordinals takes a new approach.

entry.title: Bitcoin: Will It Run Doom? Kinda
entry.summary: Bitcoin enthusiasts are uploading content to the blockchain as “inscriptions” akin to NFTs—including a playable clone of classic shooter, Doom.

entry.title: MetaMask Adds New Wallet Settings, But Is It Enough for User Privacy?
entry.summary: You can now tinker with more of the plumbing behind the popular crypto tool.

entry.title: State Street Takes 9.32% Stake in Silvergate Bank
entry.summary: The filing comes after BlackRock also increased its stake in the beleaguered crypto bank.

entry.title: Coinbase Stock Popped 26% After Class Action Lawsuit Dismissed
entry.summary: The plaintiffs claimed that Coinbase sold unregistered securities and failed to register as a broker-dealer.

entry.title: Is Anyone Using Helium? Nova Labs’ New IoT Push May Provide Answers
entry.summary: Helium co-founder Amir Haleem details plans to bring big companies to the crypto wireless network amid concerns over adoption.

entry.title: FTX Bankruptcy: Texas, California, and New Jersey Join Call for Independent Examiner
entry.summary: Many of the states are already investigating FTX for violations, Texas's securities regulator wrote in the court filing.

entry.title: What Is Canto? The Token That Rallied 700% in a Month
entry.summary: What is Canto and what is behind its astronomical spike?

entry.title: Crypto Exchange Bittrex Lays Off 83 Employees Across ‘Most Departments’
entry.summary: The Seattle-based crypto exchange Bittrex joins the growing list of firms slicing their headcounts over the past month.

entry.title: NFL Reveals First Super Bowl 'Metaverse' Concert in Roblox
entry.summary: The NFL’s latest foray into digital experiences enlists hip hop artist Saweetie.

entry.title: Member of St. Maarten’s Parliament Launches Bid to Adopt Tron as Legal Tender
entry.summary: Parliamentarian Rolando Brison wants to make Sint Maarten the Caribbean "crypto capital" after initiating legislation earlier this month.

entry.title: PleasrHouse Auctioning Couch from Original Doge Meme
entry.summary: The episode will include an appearance by photographer Atsuko Sato and the doge herself, Kabosu.

entry.title: Chainalysis Says It’s ‘Well Capitalized’ Amid Latest Workforce Cut
entry.summary: The most recent layoffs at Chainalysis will impact the sleuthing firm’s sales and marketing sector, a spokesperson said.

entry.title: Solana-Based DeFi Protocol Everlend Announces Shut Down
entry.summary: The DeFi platform Everlend said that continuing under current liquidity and market conditions “is a gamble” despite having sufficient runway.

entry.title: Bithumb’s Ex-Chairman Kang Jong-Hyun Arrested: Report
entry.summary: The former Bithumb executive is suspected of being involved in a market manipulation scheme, allege authorities.

entry.title: Bitcoin Shrugs Off Fed Rate Hike to Hit Six-Month High
entry.summary: Bitcoin, Ethereum, and the wider market are firmly in the green following the release of the Federal Reserve’s fund rate decision.

entry.title: Aptos Labs Awards $50K Grant for Blockchain in Higher Education
entry.summary: The successor to Meta's Diem blockchain joins a long list of companies funding the future of Web3.

entry.title: Zuckerberg’s Metaverse Division Loses $13.72 Billion in 2022
entry.summary: Despite the numbers, Meta’s leadership insists that the metaverse is still a top priority.

entry.title: Coinbase NFT Pauses Creator Drops, Insists Marketplace Is Not Shutting Down
entry.summary: Coinbase NFT says the move will allow its developers to focus on other features for its product.

entry.title: OpenSea's Polygon NFT Sales Top Ethereum for Second Straight Month
entry.summary: The total number of Polygon NFT sales on OpenSea beat Ethereum each of the past two months—but they're mostly low-cost assets.

entry.title: Where Did All the Terra Developers Go?
entry.summary: Eight months after the epic collapse of Terra, developers who worked on the project are now finding new homes—but many have left crypto altogether.

entry.title: Cool Cats Are Going Multi-Chain—And Adding Customizable NFTs
entry.summary: The “blue chip” PFP project has refreshed its branding and dropped gamified NFTs to holders, with full-body avatars due later this year.

entry.title: NFT Sales Jump 38% in January as Bored Apes Drive Trading Surge
entry.summary: The NFT market shows signs of life amid rising crypto prices, with the Bored Ape Yacht Club leading the charge.

entry.title: gm: Week in Review: Tech Layoffs, Porsche NFTs, Ted Cruz
entry.summary: In our January 28, 2023 week in review episode, Dan Roberts, Matthew Diemer, and Kate Irwin talk about more layoffs in crypto and broader tech (including how Google botched its layoffs), the NFT market rebound and Porsche’s NFT drop (fail or surprise success?), Sam Bankman-Fried’s latest claims about FTX US and the surprising list of big companies on the FTX creditor list, and Ted Cruz’s weird effort to get DC vendors to accept Bitcoin. Watch and make sure to subscribe to the gm podcast on Apple or Spotify.

entry.title: How Web3 Is Disrupting Video Streaming: Myco, Theta Labs, and Actor David Bianchi
entry.summary: At an investor event in L.A. hosted by watch-to-earn video streaming platform Myco, Decrypt's Sander Lutz moderated a discussion about Film3 with Myco CCO Phil McKenzie, Theta Labs BD Head Andrea Berry, and actor and filmmaker David Bianchi, whose Web3 series "RZR" got funding through NFT drops.

entry.title: How Web3 and NFTs Are Disrupting Film: Myco, Livepeer, Ava Labs, Bad Grrls Creative Club
entry.summary: At an investor event in New York hosted by the watch-to-earn video streaming platform Myco, Decrypt's Dan Roberts moderated a lively chat about Film3 with Phil McKenzie from Myco, Toni Thai Sterrett the founder of NFT member collective Bad Grrls Creative Club, Doug Petkanics the founder of decentralized video hosting platform Livepeer, and Daniel Killeen of Avalanche blockchain developer Ava Labs.

entry.title: 'Iron Man' Comic Artist Sean Chen on Marvel vs. Web3
entry.summary: Marvel and DC Comics alum Sean Chen argues that while studios have made billions, comic artists aren't seeing even a fraction of that wealth.

entry.title: Marvel Artist Sean Chen on How Artificial Intelligence Will Shape Comics
entry.summary: "Eventually there's still a human brain that needs to be involved," Chen said of AI being used to create comics.

entry.title: Actor David Bianchi Previews His Web3 TV Series 'RZR'
entry.summary: Veteran actor David Bianchi spoke to Decrypt's Jason Nelson right before a public table read for Bianchi's upcoming drama series "RZR," to be distributed through Gala Films. The show is already greenlit and will be set in a dystopian future Los Angeles, with Ethereum and other digital assets as part of the plot. Bianchi also conducted two NFT drops to build engagement from fans.

entry.title: gm: Farokh and the Rug Radio Roadmap
entry.summary: Meet Mr. NFT: @Farokh, who preaches daily to hundreds of thousands of NFT faithful, and is trying to building Rug Radio into a fully formed Web3 media company. Dan Roberts and Kate Irwin from the gm podcast talk to Farokh about Rug DAO and all things NFT culture. Watch and make sure to subscribe to the gm podcast on Apple or Spotify.

entry.title: gm: Big Bold Predictions for Crypto in 2023
entry.summary: Will Sam Bankman-Fried serve prison time? Who will be the next crypto company to go bankrupt, or the next founder to see their reputation dissolve? Will we get a new crypto law this year? Decrypt's Dan Roberts, Stacy Elliott, and Matthew Diemer of the gm podcast crew kicked off the new year by trading predictions for 2023. Watch and make sure to subscribe to the gm podcast on Apple or Spotify.
